Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the time it used to take to get approval to build a highway, stating that it took 17, 18, 20, or 21 years, which is not supported by the data.
Understate: The claim understates the current approval time for building highways, stating that it has been reduced to two years and will be further reduced to one year, while the data shows that the median wait time in fiscal 2019 was 3.83 years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the approval time for building highways has been significantly reduced.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the reduction in approval time for building highways is solely due to the current administration's efforts, without considering other factors or previous initiatives.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the reduction in approval time, such as changes in regulations or processes implemented before the current administration.
